headline: South Carolina Is Changing, but Will It Elect a Democratic Senator?
text: CHARLESTON, S.C. — Jaime Harrison, the surprisingly competitive Democratic challenger in the U.S. Senate race in South Carolina, will need a lot more supporters like Nikki Hinske if he wants to defeat Lindsey Graham, the savvy, shape-shifting fixture of Republican Washington who is vying for a fourth term.
snippet: The state hasn’t had a Democratic senator in decades. Mr. Harrison is betting that immigration and growing support from women will change that.
